 2.4 - NAVIGABLE
MULTIPLE WAYS(LEVEL AA)
On accessible websites...

More than one way is available to locate a Web page within a set of Web pages
except where the Web Page is the result of, or a step in, a process. 

These websites...

Provide ways to help users navigate, find content, and determine where they are.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 Where content is a result of a process or task - Search engine results. 

A search engine provides the search results based on user input. There is no
other way to locate the search results except to perform the search process
itself. 

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/multiple-ways.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 21 May 2021 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2021/WD-WCAG22-20210521/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
